title: Zabezpečení PC
content: Dobrý den, tak jsem si zakoupil z důvodu neustálého upozorňování na hrozby roční ochranu Avast premium security a domníval jsem se ,že mám PC s Windows 10 na rok chráněn. Není to pravda, Avast mě neustále upozorňuje na hrozby typu, že můj PC je sledován (kritická úroveň) a je nezbytné tyto hrozby odstranit dalším předplatným. Nahlédnutím na jejich možnosti ochrany jsem zjistil, že nabízí téměř osm možností a za každou platbu zvlášť. Mám ty varovné signály ignorovat, nebo co mi poradíte? Děkuji za odpověď a přeji příjemný den. Helešic Drahomír

title: Why is Firefox not displaying my menu page layout correctly?
content:
Hi Mozilla Support,

I’m facing an issue where the layout and some images on my website’s menu pages aren’t displaying correctly in Firefox, while everything works fine in Chrome and Edge.

I’ve cleared the cache, tested in private mode, and disabled all extensions, but the issue still persists. The problem mostly affects structured pages like our firehousesubs-menue, which rely on JavaScript and CSS to display dynamic content and detailed firehouse subs offerings properly.

Is this a rendering issue specific to Firefox, or could certain scripts or styles be getting blocked? Any advice or fixes would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!
creator: michalsmith188

title: Hall of Fame Inclusion Request for Resolved Security Report
content:
Dear Mozilla Security Team, I hope this message finds you well.

I would like to express my sincere appreciation to the Mozilla team for acknowledging my recent security vulnerability submission and for awarding a bounty of $1K+ USD in recognition of my contribution. I am truly grateful for the opportunity to support Mozilla’s mission in maintaining a safer and more secure open-source ecosystem.

I am writing to kindly request inclusion of my name in the Mozilla Security Bug Bounty Hall of Fame for the year 2025, in recognition of the following resolved and patched vulnerability:

HackerOne Report ID: https://hackerone.com/reports/3110586

As the vulnerability has been addressed and acknowledged by your security team, I would be honored if my contribution could be publicly recognized in the Hall of Fame. This would serve not only as a token of appreciation but also as a professional reference that reflects my dedication to ethical security research and responsible disclosure.

Here are the details I kindly request to be listed under:

  • Name: Andri PwnOsec Groups
  • Reference: https://github.com/odaysec

Thank you once again for the transparency, professionalism, and the encouragement your team provides to the global security research community. I look forward to continuing to contribute to Mozilla and other open-source initiatives in the future.

Warm regards, Andri (PwnOsec Groups) https://github.com/odaysec
creator: odaysec

title: Firefox Loads Page Slowly – Works Fine on Other Browsers
content:
Hi Mozilla Support,

I’m experiencing an issue when trying to open a specific page on my website in Firefox. The page either loads very slowly or sometimes remains stuck on a blank screen. I’ve tested the same page in Chrome and Edge, and it loads normally there, so the issue appears to be specific to Firefox.

I’ve already tried clearing the cache, running the browser in private mode, and disabling all add-ons, but the problem still persists. Could this be related to JavaScript rendering, caching, or some Firefox-specific incompatibility?

The site uses dynamic content to present structured items like secret menus and detailed firehouse subs offerings. I'd like to ensure it renders smoothly for Firefox users. Any insights or troubleshooting steps would be much appreciated.

Thanks in advance!
creator: michalsmith188

title: Firefox Not Displaying Images Properly on Specific Pages
content:
i Mozilla Support,

I'm encountering a problem where certain images on my website aren't loading properly in Firefox. They appear as broken or just don’t render at all, while everything works fine in Chrome and Edge. I've double-checked the image paths, formats (mostly JPG and PNG), and server headers — everything looks okay.

This issue seems to affect only specific menu pages. For example, pages structured like raising canes-menus fail to display food images that are essential to the layout. Could this be related to how Firefox handles image caching or lazy loading on https://raisingcanes-menus.com/chicken-finger/ ?

Looking forward to any help or direction. Thanks in advance!
creator: proseo2026

title: Firefox Loads Page Slowly or Not at All – Works Fine on Other Browsers
content:
Hi Mozilla Support,

I'm facing an issue where a specific page on my website loads very slowly or sometimes remains blank when viewed in Firefox. However, the same page works perfectly in Chrome and Edge.

I’ve already cleared the cache, tried private mode, and disabled all add-ons, but the problem still occurs. Could this be related to JavaScript rendering, caching, or a browser-specific incompatibility?

The issue concerns a menu page, and I’m seeing similar structure on other sections like raising canes-menus, so I want to ensure it doesn't affect those as well. Any suggestions or fixes would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks!

title: This site can’t be reached Check if there is a typo in rserv1.bog.gov.sa. DNS_PROBE_FINISHED_NXDOMAIN
content:
Dear Sir/Madam,

I hope this message finds you well.

I am writing to report an issue in accessing the subdomain rserv1.bog.gov.sa. Upon attempting to open the link, I encountered the following error: 

   This site can’t be reached    DNS_PROBE_FINISHED_NXDOMAIN

This indicates that the domain cannot be resolved through DNS, which may be due to a configuration issue, a decommissioned subdomain, or a typographical error in the published link.

Kindly confirm whether this subdomain is still active, and if so, please advise on the proper access link or whether there are any known technical issues at the moment.

If the address has changed or is no longer in use, I would appreciate it if you could provide the updated URL or any alternative instructions.

Thank you for your assistance and support.

Best regards, Omar Sidic Macay Mobile: +966547753132 Email: omacay73@gmail.com Location: Hail, Saudi Arabia

title: Cannot Launch Bill Pay
content:
Recently, in the last few weeks, when I try to play BitChute videos, I click on play button and it disappears and nothing happens. Now, within the last 2 weeks, I cannot access BillPay. I get an error message , "return to internet banking and relaunch." I can launch both programs in Chrome. Please tell me how to fix these problems. I would rather use Firefox.

I have read about clear cache, taking off ad blockers, etc. These problems happened from one day to the next without many any setting changes to my knowledge. I thought about system restore but it will only go back to 07/25 at this point.

Thank you in advance for your help.

Janis Reed

title: "This file not commonly downloaded" pop-up when opening new window.
content: I downloaded some zipped programs yesterday from regular websites, and got a warning "This file is not commonly downloaded." Fine, whatever. Seemed like they didn't download, then they did. I deleted them afterwards. Now whenever I open Firefox (and it's not running in another window) I get a popup showing the program downloads and warning, as if I just tried to download them. I deleted them from history, but still get the popup, so they keep showing in my download history. I've tried ALL the usual fixes in Settings, looked for the files stored in Mozilla folders, rebooted and restarted the modem, no luck. Maybe it's a Windows Defender update causing this. How to stop this annoyance?
creator: spiritgumm1
